org.opendaylight.controller.usermanager.internal

Class UserManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opendaylight.controller.usermanager.internal.UserManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CommandProvider, IConfigurationAware, IConfigurationAwareCommon, IObjectReader, IUserManager, org.springframework.security.authentication.AuthenticationProvider, org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UserDetailsService

    public class UserManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements IUserManager, IObjectReader, IConfigurationAware, CommandProvider, org.springframework.security.authentication.AuthenticationProvider
    The internal implementation of the User Manager.

      • getUserLevel

        public UserLevel getUserLevel(java.lang.String username)
        Description copied from interface: IUserManager
        Returns the highest user level for the passed user name. It checks the roles assigned to this user and checks against the well known Controller user roles to determines the highest user level associated with the user
        Specified by:
        getUserLevel in interface IUserManager
        Parameters:
        username - the user name
        Returns:
        UserLevel the highest user level for this user

      • getUserLevels

        Description copied from interface: IUserManager

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • isRoleInUse

        public boolean isRoleInUse(java.lang.String role)
        Description copied from interface: IUserManager
        Checks if the specified role belongs to any application. Usually an application will call this function when configuring a role, to check if that role is already being used by another application.
        Specified by:
        isRoleInUse in interface IUserManager
        Parameters:
        role - The role to check
        Returns:
        true if the specified role belongs to any application or if the role is a well-known controller role, false otherwise.
